text: Daniel Karlin (born December 4, 1953) is a British literary scholar and Winterstoke Professor of English at the University of Bristol. He is known for his works on nineteenth and twentieth century British and American literature. ==Books== *The Courtship of Robert Browning and Elizabeth Barrett (1985) *Browning’s Hatreds (1993) *Penguin Book of Victorian Verse (1997) *Proust’s English (2005) ==References== Category:Living people Category:1953 births Category:Academics of the University of Bristol Category:British literary critics
title: Daniel Karlin
